Note: Date based on America's participation in the war. Orientation: Vertical.
Description: Design for a newspaper and magazine advertisement for  a Liberty Loan campaign.  The text says that the boys are fighting in France and paying their highest price so that Americans and their children's children may live and be free. "Buy Liberty Bonds to stamp out the plague of the Hun for all time." Illustration shows a little girl praying over the grave of a soldier.
Digital Collection: Allied Posters of World War I
Local Rights Statement: This material is made available for private study, scholarship, and research use. For access to the original or a high resolution reproduction, contact: Temple University Libraries, Special Collections Research Center, scrc@temple.edu, 215-204-8257.

Title: The highest price
